Title: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
Description: A simple and classic Italian pasta dish made with garlic, olive oil, and red pepper flakes.
Instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.
In a pan, heat olive oil over low heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakes, sauté until garlic is golden.
Add cooked spaghetti to the pan, toss to coat in the garlic oil mixture.
Season with salt and pepper, garnish with chopped parsley.
Serve hot and enjoy!

Title: Margherita Pizza
Description: A classic Italian pizza topped with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, and olive oil.
Instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C).
Roll out the pizza dough on a baking sheet.
Spread marinara sauce over the dough, leaving a border for the crust.
Arrange sliced mozzarella and tomatoes on top of the sauce.
Bake in the oven for 12-15 minutes or until crust is golden and cheese is melted.
Remove from oven, top with fresh basil leaves, drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper.
Slice and serve hot!

Title: Risotto ai Funghi
Description: A creamy and flavorful Italian risotto made with mushrooms, Arborio rice, and Parmesan cheese.
Instructions: In a saucepan, heat the broth and keep it warm over low heat.
In a separate pan, melt butter and sauté onion and garlic until translucent.
Add mushrooms and cook until they release their juices.
Stir in Arborio rice and cook for a minute.
Deglaze with white wine and let it evaporate.
Begin adding warm broth one ladle at a time, stirring constantly until absorbed.
Continue this process until rice is creamy and cooked al dente.
Stir in Parmesan cheese, season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot and enjoy!

Title: Chicken Piccata
Description: A delicious Italian chicken dish cooked in a lemon, butter, and caper sauce.
Instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper, dredge in flour.
In a skillet, heat olive oil and 2 tbsp butter over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken until golden brown on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Remove chicken from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add chicken broth, lemon juice, capers, and remaining butter.
Simmer the sauce until slightly thickened.
Return chicken to the skillet, coat with the sauce.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve hot!

Title: Tiramisu
Description: A classic Italian dessert made with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cream.
Instructions: In a bowl, combine mascarpone cheese, sugar, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Dip each ladyfinger into the brewed espresso and arrange a layer at the bottom of a dish.
Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers.
Repeat with another layer of dipped ladyfingers and mascarpone mixture.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Before serving, dust the top with cocoa powder.
Slice and enjoy this decadent dessert!
